questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Using only evidence from Table 1, describe how the students conducted their questionnaire surver.

questions.question: Use the data in Table 1 to write a report on the use of ICT by tourists to plan their holiday trip to Penang.

questions.question: Describe the method the students used for collecting the data shown in Table 2.Calculate the values in the cells labelled X and Y.

questions.question: Suggest how the students can improve their data collection method to ensure the validity of their data.

questions.question: Describe how the data in Table 2 can be presented graphically so that a conclusion can be made easily on the local people's perception of tourism on the environment.

questions.question: State the % change in tourist arrivals from May to Jul 2015; and the % change in tourism revenue in June 2015 compared to the same period in 2014.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Explain how the MERS outbreak caused a fall in tourist arrivals in South Korea

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: 'Tourism development improves the lives of the local people'. How far do you agree with this statement? Support your answer with exampkes you have studied.

questions.question: Compare the price of rice and pork in China from 2008 to 2016.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Define food security and explain how named countries ensure food security for their citizens.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Describe changes in the calorie intake of the countries shown in Figure 4 from 1980 to 2010.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Explain how social and economic factors cause variations in food consumption between developed countries and developing countries.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: The consequences of excessive consumption of food are more serious than the consequences of under-consumption of food. How far do you agree? Explain your answer using specific located examples and details you have studied.
